summary: This is an email chain from October 2020 between an Assistant United States Attorney and an FBI forensic examiner regarding the technical review of image and video files extracted from devices in the Epstein investigation. The discussion focuses on the status of processing specific device images, including one that was a wiped drive.

connections.description: Prosecutor and forensic examiner coordinating on the technical review of evidence in the Epstein investigation, as shown by their email exchange about device files.

events.title: Forensic Evidence Drop-off
events.description: The FBI forensic examiner dropped off image and video files from Epstein devices to the prosecutor's office.

events.title: Coordination Call Scheduled
events.description: The prosecutor and forensic examiner schedule a call to discuss the most efficient way to review all the Epstein image and video files.

keyFacts: The document confirms active forensic review of evidence from Epstein devices was ongoing in October 2020, over a year after Epstein's death.
Specific device evidence numbers are referenced (e.g., NYC024329, NYC024342, NYC024353), indicating a structured evidence collection and processing system.
One device (NYC024342) is identified as a 'wiped drive' containing no data, which is a notable forensic finding.
The email is subject to a protective order, restricting its disclosure and highlighting the sensitivity of the evidence discussed.
